exceptions.exn: Cannot find a relation to rewrite.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
l: lb

Goal:
lb_shift (S n) l = ⟘ :: lb_shift n l

Premises:
lb_shift = fun (n : nat) (l : lb) => lb_bots n ++ l : nat -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_shift _%nat_scope _%list_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation lb := (list bool)
lb_shift_0 : forall l : lb, lb_shift 0 l = l
list_an_S : forall a n : nat, list_an a (S n) = a :: list_an (S a) n
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (S n) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
firstn_cons : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A) (l : list A), firstn (S n) (a :: l) = a :: firstn n l
lb_bots = fix lb_bots (n : nat) : lb := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => ⟘ :: lb_bots n0 end : nat -> lb Arguments lb_bots _%nat_scope
nat_lb_fix_1 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> ⟬ 2 * n ⟭ = ⟘ :: ⟬ n ⟭
lb_ortho_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
div_2_fix_1 : forall n : nat, div (2 * n) 2 = n
Inductive lb_ortho : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_ortho_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⟂ l | in_lb_ortho_1 : forall l : lb, l ⟂ nil | in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m Arguments lb_ortho (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_1 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_2 [x y]%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
div_2_fix_2 : forall n : nat, div (1 + 2 * n) 2 = n
lb_succ = fix lb_succ (a : bool) (l : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => a :: nil | x :: l0 => let (r, z) := bin_add ⟘ a x in z :: lb_succ r l0 end : bool -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_succ _%bool_scope _%list_scope
cons_seq : forall len start : nat, start :: seq (S start) len = seq start (S len)
rem_2_fix_1 : forall n : nat, rem (2 * n) 2 = 0
in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m
nat_lb_1 = eq_ind_r (fun l : lb => l = ⟙ :: nil) (eq_ind_r (fun l : lb => ⟙ :: l = ⟙ :: nil) eq_refl nat_lb_fix_0) (nat_lb_fix_2 0) : ⟬ 1 ⟭ = ⟙ :: nil
rem_2_fix_2 : forall n : nat, rem (1 + 2 * n) 2 = 1
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
g_nlb_ind : forall P : nat -> lb -> Prop, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
g_nlb_sind : forall P : nat -> lb -> SProp, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_mul : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n * m) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
lb_nat_fix_1 : forall l : lb, ⟦ ⟘ :: l ⟧ = 2 * ⟦ l ⟧
Inductive g_nlb : nat -> lb -> Prop := in_gnlb_0 : g_nlb 0 nil | in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l) | in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l) Arguments g_nlb _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_1 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_2 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope
lb_ortho_cons_inv : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⟂ y :: m -> (x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘) /\ l ⟂ m
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_le : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_lt : forall n m : nat, n < m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : lb), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N ⟙ andb) l lH -> forall lmp : list (bool * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol bool), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) bool_eq (triv_div ⟘ ⟙ bool_eq) lH = lmp ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N ⟙ andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev ⟘ ⟙ xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) ⟘ ⟙ bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
Znat.Nat2Z.is_nonneg : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
lb_mask_inv_left : forall (x : bool) (l : lb), x :: l ⪯ nil -> x = ⟘ /\ l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_equiv = fun l m : lb => l ⪯ m /\ m ⪯ l : lb -> lb -> Prop Arguments lb_mask_equiv (_ _)%list_scope
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l)
in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l)
lb_meet = lb_pointwise andb : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_meet (_ _)%list_scope
lb_join = lb_pointwise orb : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_join (_ _)%list_scope
lb_mask_inv_cons_cons : forall l m : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ ⟘ :: m -> False
lb_plus = fix lb_plus (a : bool) (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => lb_succ a m | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => lb_succ a l | y :: m0 => let (r, z) := bin_add a x y in z :: lb_plus r l0 m0 end end : bool -> lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_plus _%bool_scope (_ _)%list_scope
lb_mask_inv_nil : forall l : lb, ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil -> l ⪯ nil
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
